title: Energy conservation - sliding uphill with friction

content.question: A rock of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> slides toward a ramp and has speed <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> when it reaches the bottom of the ramp, which is at an angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> to the horizontal, as shown. The coefficient of kinetic friction between the rock and the ramp is <math alttext="mu sub k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>k</mi></msub></math>. The rock slides a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> up the hill before stopping at a vertical distance <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi></math> above the bottom of the ramp. Which of the following expressions is equal to the force of friction exerted on the rock?

choices.label: <math alttext="mu sub k, end sub, m g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>k</mi></msub><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="m g times the cosine of theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi><mi>cos</mi><mi>θ</mi></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator m v sub 0, end sub, squared and denominator 2 d, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><msubsup><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>d</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator m, times open parenthesis, v sub 0, end sub, squared minus 2 g h, close parenthesis, and denominator 2 d, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msubsup><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi><mi>h</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>d</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator m, times open parenthesis, v sub 0, end sub, squared minus 2 g h, close parenthesis, and denominator 2 d, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msubsup><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi><mi>h</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>d</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>
